content.description: Basically a highball boulder problem, but a really fun boulder problem. Lots of good holds with big reaches in between. Pull hard and fast and you're gonna have a good time.
content.location: Zapped is the fourth bolted line from the left underneath the roof (not counting "Sweet Leaf"). It is immediately to the right of the corner trad climb "End of the Cluster."

climbs.name: Sweet Leaf
climbs.fa: Leif Faber, Matt Queen, Jeff Frizzell

content.description: Crux going from 1 to 2. Nice holds to a trickly finish.
content.location: first route on the left side of the Rainy Day wall

content.description: A short but decent crack that can be protected strictly by nuts.  It goes up and right.
content.protection: Small-medium sized gear + can share anchor from neighboring sport route
content.location: First route inside the Rainy Day Roof.  Left most route.

content.description:
A liitle bit techy at the crux from 2 to 3. A bit pumpy to finish.  

  The grade is a guess please add your opinion
content.protection: 4 bolts, anchor is 2 Metolious rap bolts in the roof (a little hard to see from the ground)
content.location: Just right of Fat and Sassy 5.9, the second bolted route right of the obvious corner "End of the Cluster."

content.description: This is the only route of Rainy Day Roof that goes all the way to the top.Â
content.location: Directly to the right of Silver Lining

content.description: Pull up onto the route using good jugs until about the second bolt, where the route transitions into crimps. The crux is moving out right and to clip the anchors. After a few falls, I found it best to clip whlie right hand is on the lower right undercling with high feet, instead of trying to use the higher hold on the left.
5.10 a/b Its the first sport route, just right of "Spinkles". 3 QD + anchor. From "Vertical Heartland" 3rd edition by Eric Ulner
Hop up to ledge to for the first bolt. Then either follow the leftward leaning crack with some underclings or move slightly left and use a combination of the face the crack.
content.location: 5 feet right of End of the Cluster, just out from underneath the Rainy Day Roof

content.description: Utilize fingerlocks and good face holds; its more fun than it looks from the ground.
content.location: End of the Cluster is the obvious clean corner just outside the right edge of the roof. It is immediately to the right of Zapped, and to the left of Fat and Sassy. It could theoretically be toproped off either anchor, with some swing potential.

content.description: Low crux passing the first bolt. Relentless to tricky finish.
content.location: Second route to the right of Silver Lining.

content.description: Great for technical climbs and fancy foot work!
